meanings.definition: A member of an Arab princely family descended from Muhammad.
meanings.sent1: The sharifs in the palace were known for their noble lineage.
meanings.sent2: The town celebrated the arrival of the sharifs with a grand feast.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children jokingly called themselves the sharifs of the playground.
meanings.sent4: In the community, he was regarded as the sharif of wisdom and guidance.
meanings.sent5: The old book depicted the sharifs as guardians of ancient traditions.

meanings.definition: A title of respect for descendants of the Prophet Muhammad.
meanings.sent1: The villagers greeted the respected elder with the title of sharifs.
meanings.sent2: The scholars were honored with the title of sharifs for their knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The playful children pretended to be little sharifs of the village.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity earned her the title of sharifs among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The wise man was known as the sharifs of compassion and understanding.

meanings.definition: A Muslim ruler in certain Arab countries.
meanings.sent1: The sharifs of the kingdom were known for their fair rule.
meanings.sent2: The people respected the authority of the sharifs in the region.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat acted like the sharifs of the household, demanding attention.
meanings.sent4: The CEO was considered the sharifs of the company, making important decisions.
meanings.sent5: The majestic eagle soared high in the sky, symbolizing the sharifs of freedom.
